title: Sunny memories of foreign lands.
author: Stowe, Harriet Beecher
snippet: The town is beautifully situated on the Firth of Tay, which here spreads its waters, and the quantity of shipping indicates commercial prosperity.

title: Journal of a lady of quality;
author: Schaw, Janet
snippet: There he continued to live until 1738, when he was appointed collector of customs at Perth, at the head of the Firth of Tay, serving in that capacity until 1751, when he became assistant to Harnage, the register-general of tobacco in Scotland, with the title of assistant in Scotland to the register-general in England.

title: Travels in the United States of America, in the years 1806& 1807, and 1809, 1810, & 1811;
author: Melish, John
snippet: On drawing towards our place of destination, the road descends by a winding course of considerable extent, from whence there is a beautiful view of the Firth of Tay, which we crossed by a ferry nearly three miles broad, and immediately entered the town of Dundee, where I stopped for the night.

title: Scotland Picturesque and Traditional. A pilgrimage with staff and knapsack
author: Todd, George Eyre.
snippet: Firth of Tay, it stretches in the sun, a broad alluvial district, perhapsthe richest and most fertile soil in Scotland.
